column1: What are the busiest days of the week and hours of the day (most orders)?
column2: Orders begin around 7–8 AM, peak between 14:00–16:00, with mornings busier than afternoons. Weekly peaks occur on Friday and Saturday (weekend).

column1: Are there particular times of the day when people spend the most money?
column2: Highest order values occur between midnight and 7 AM, drop until noon, then rise slightly until 22:00.

column1: How can we group products into simpler price ranges?
column2: Prices can be divided into three ranges: below $5, between $5 and $15, and between $15 and $25. Very few items fall into the highest range.

column1: Are there differences in ordering habits based on customer’s region?
column2: User profiles are concentrated in the South (young singles <25), while Northeast has lowest population. Also the highest and lowest spenders are in the south.

column1: Is there a connection between age and family status in ordering habits?
column2: Married customers: late 30s–60s; singles: up to late 50s; living with parents: until 20; divorced/widowed: 65+.

column2: No significant differences in frequency or expenditure across profiles; all order at similar rates and spend similar amounts.
